article_node.title: Emergency alert to be sent to Brits' phones in public safety exercise
article_node.summary: The UK will conduct a nationwide emergency alert test next Sunday at 3 pm, sending a 10‑second siren to all 4G/5G phones as a drill. The exercise is part of the Resilience Action Plan, which includes £1 billion for new bio‑security centres and £4.2 billion for flood defences, and follows earlier real alerts such as Storm Éowyn. The test is overseen by COBR to ensure the system can quickly warn citizens and improve national preparedness.
